## findRectangle() function

Looks for a rectangle of the specified size, fully filled with the specified color, with the given color tolerance, in the given image.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function findRectangle(image: PNG, color: [number, number, number, number], expectedWidth: number, expectedHeight: number, colorTolerance: number): Rectangle | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  image | PNG | image where to look for the rectangle |
|  color | \[number, number, number, number\] | color of the rectangle to look for, expressed as an array of four numbers between 0 and 255, representing the red, green, blue and alpha parts |
|  expectedWidth | number | expected width of the rectangle, in pixels |
|  expectedHeight | number | expected height of the rectangle, in pixels |
|  colorTolerance | number | allowed difference in the color, 0 meaning no difference. The difference is computed as the sum of the absolute value of the difference for each red, green, blue and alpha parts. |

<b>Returns:</b>

[Rectangle](./vm-providers.rectangle.md) \| null

The rectangle if it is found, or null otherwise.
